meanings.sent1: The artist used indigoid to paint the sky in the picture.
meanings.sent2: The indigoid of the ocean was mesmerizing under the moonlight.
meanings.sent3: The indigoid of the crayon made the drawing of the sea look realistic.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with an indigoid that seemed to hold the secrets of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The indigoid of the forget-me-not flowers stood out against the green leaves.

meanings.definition: A substance that produces a deep blue color.
meanings.sent1: The dye made from indigoid was used to color the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The indigoid was carefully mixed into the paint to achieve the perfect shade.
meanings.sent3: The indigoid spilled on the floor, creating a mess that looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The indigoid dye transformed the plain cloth into a vibrant blue masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The indigoid substance left a trail of blue wherever it touched.

meanings.sent1: The indigoid dress she wore matched the color of the night sky.
meanings.sent2: His indigoid eyes shone with a depth that seemed to hold a universe within.
meanings.sent3: The indigoid walls of the room gave it a calming and peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The indigoid hue of the flower petals made them look like they were touched by magic.
meanings.sent5: The indigoid sunset painted the sky in hues of blue and purple.
